page.title: 11LANDSCAPE AND BUILDINGS
page.content: The landscape within our block is dominated by the {Black Mountains} which rise in the North of the block. The rest of the block consists of villages built along valley floors. The building within these villages are typical of an area dominated by early coal works: With a large number of short terraced streets of company houses. The main buildings of architectural interest, within the block, are the two {Public Halls}one in Brynamman and one in Garnant. Both have been converted into cinemas at one time oranother and whilst the Brynamman Hall is still used to this end the Garnant Hall has now been sold and converted into a warehouse for a local firm of building suppliers.
